featured.text: Celebration often begins with mukaebi (welcoming fire), during which people make a small bonfire in front of their house to guide spirits upon their return back home.

definition.zh_def: 日本傳統的火祭，通常在夏季舉行，以驅趕邪靈和迎接祖先的靈魂。
definition.en_def: A traditional Japanese fire festival, typically held in summer, to drive away evil spirits and welcome the souls of ancestors.
definition.example: During the mukaebi festival, people gather to light bonfires and celebrate with their families.
